event: #StillConcerned posts a list of demands on Twitter paralleling the demands from 2015.
The Maneater publishes an editorial standing with the members of #StillConcerned and calling for Choi's resignation.
The Mizzou Black Student Athlete Association organizes a march to "promote unity against the injustices that continue in the nation."
Choi blocks students who  criticize his administration on Twitter.
Choi unblocks students on Twitter following the threat of a lawsuit.
J-School professors publish open letter denouncing his silencing of dissent on campus.
MO Coalition for COVID saftey issues a list of demands to President Choi and UM System Board of Curators.
MSA President Payton Head posts on Facebook about his experiences with racism on campus.
Graduate and undergraduate students organize "Racism Lives Here" protests.
Students block Wolfe's car during the homecoming parade.
Jonathan Butler writes an open letter to Chancellor Loftin in response to his diversity training plan.
Concerned Student 1950 issues a list of demands to MU, among them is the demand for Wolfe's resignation.
Concerned Student 1950 meets with Wolfe who refuses to meet their demands.
Johnathan Butler begins a hunger strike in response to Wolfe's dismissing of Black students' concerns.
Black football players announce they will not participate in any football related activities until Wolfe resigns.
Students begin a boycott in support of Butler's protest.
Wolfe and Loftin resign as UM System President and MU Chancellor, respectively.
